intro: Scheelea amylacea, commonly known as the white spider plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and ease of care. Scheelea amylacea thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
